meanings.definition: To surpass in handling or managing
meanings.sent1: She outhandles her classmates in solving math problems.
meanings.sent2: The experienced chef outhandles the new trainee in the kitchen.
meanings.sent3: Despite his clumsy appearance, he outhandles any challenge that comes his way.
meanings.sent4: Her ability to outhandles difficult situations sets her apart from others.
meanings.sent5: He outhandles every task with ease and efficiency.

meanings.definition: To have a greater number of handles than
meanings.sent1: The new mug outhandles the old one with its extra handle.
meanings.sent2: This toolbox outhandles the other one because it has more grips.
meanings.sent3: The suitcase surprisingly outhandles the backpack in terms of convenience.
meanings.sent4: Her purse outhandles mine with its multiple straps.
meanings.sent5: The teapot outhandles the kettle due to its additional handle.

meanings.definition: To outdo in skill or ability in handling
meanings.sent1: He outhandles his opponents on the tennis court with his precise shots.
meanings.sent2: The artist outhandles others in creating intricate designs.
meanings.sent3: She outhandles her siblings in persuading their parents to agree.
meanings.sent4: His craftsmanship outhandles that of his peers in the woodworking class.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic outhandles any car problem that comes into the shop.

meanings.definition: To exceed in the number of handles
meanings.sent1: The new shopping bag outhandles the old one with its extra straps.
meanings.sent2: This drawer outhandles the others because it has more pulls.
meanings.sent3: The bucket surprisingly outhandles the basket in terms of carrying capacity.
meanings.sent4: Her tote bag outhandles mine with its additional handles.
meanings.sent5: The cart outhandles the wheelbarrow due to its multiple grips.
